summary: This document is an email chain from August 14-15, 2019, between Bureau of Prisons staff discussing the need for prayer and support for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York during a difficult time, which appears to be in the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York
persons.context: The sender/recipient of emails expressing the need for prayer and support for staff at MCC New York during a difficult period.

persons.name: I. T. Specialist/NCIC Coordinator/ PST (Resource Unit Leader) Computer Services Department
persons.role: IT Specialist/NCIC Coordinator at FCC Yazoo City or similar facility
persons.context: Correspondent exchanging supportive messages and prayers with the Associate Warden at MCC New York.

connections.person2: I. T. Specialist/NCIC Coordinator/ PST (Resource Unit Leader) Computer Services Department
connections.description: Colleagues within the Bureau of Prisons system exchanging supportive messages regarding a difficult situation at MCC New York.

events.title: Initial check-in email
events.description: An email is sent asking 'Are you okay' to the Associate Warden at MCC New York.
personsInvolved: I. T. Specialist/NCIC Coordinator/ PST (Resource Unit Leader) Computer Services Department

events.title: Ongoing supportive correspondence
events.description: A series of emails on August 15, 2019, where staff offer prayers and support to the Associate Warden and staff at MCC New York during a 'difficult time'.
personsInvolved: I. T. Specialist/NCIC Coordinator/ PST (Resource Unit Leader) Computer Services Department

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
FCC Yazoo City (implied from 'Computer Services Department FCC Yazoo')
keyFacts: The email chain dates from August 14-15, 2019, which is immediately following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
The content strongly suggests the 'difficult time' referenced is the aftermath and investigation into Epstein's death.
The correspondence shows Bureau of Prisons staff at different facilities offering spiritual and emotional support to colleagues at MCC New York.
The Associate Warden at MCC New York requests continued prayers for themselves and their staff.
The tone is supportive and religious, with references to 'FATHER', 'pray', and 'God bless'.
